decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to utilize the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana and play powerful colorless creatures and planeswalkers while controlling the opponent's board through removal spells and graveyard hate. The deck aims to establish board dominance with cards such as Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, while also utilizing cards like Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying to search for key pieces like Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower. The inclusion of spells like Path to Exile, Oblivion Stone, and Relic of Progenitus helps maintain control of the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying multiple artifacts onto the battlefield and using cards like Arcbound Ravager and Cranial Plating to pump up creatures and deal damage efficiently. With cards like Steel Overseer to further boost creature power and Galvanic Blast for added removal, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy. The key concept is to utilize the synergy between artifacts and creature abilities to create a lethal and efficient aggro strategy, taking advantage of the affinity mechanic for powerful early game plays.

The main idea of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to use powerful Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm your opponent, supported by efficient mana acceleration from cards like Noble Hierarch and Ancient Stirrings. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Drowner of Hope, while also providing some control with cards like Eldrazi Displacer and Path to Exile. The inclusion of Engineered Explosives allows for additional board control against opposing threats. Overall, this deck focuses on aggressive, high-impact plays to secure victory in Modern 1 vs 1 matchups.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with efficient and powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. It also has removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate to deal with threats on the board. Additionally, the deck utilizes planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope to control the battlefield and generate value. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and enable powerful plays throughout the game.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on a balanced mix of early aggression and disruptive elements. With a solid mana base and efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Siege Rhino, it aims to apply pressure on opponents quickly. The deck also includes hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, as well as removal spells like Fatal Push and Path to Exile to deal with threats. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Lingering Souls provides added control and value. Overall, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory.

The focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Explore, Farseek, and Search for Tomorrow in order to get Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle online as soon as possible. Once Valakut is active, the deck aims to use Scapeshift and Primeval Titan to quickly deal a large amount of damage to the opponent by sacrificing lands and triggering Valakut's ability. Additionally, cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Khalni Heart Expedition provide additional ramp and support for the combo. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Anger of the Gods to control the board.

The deck focuses on quickly and efficiently generating mana with cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism, while using Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace to draw through the entire library. Once the combo is set up, players can win with Laboratory Maniac or Lightning Storm. The deck also includes Pact of Negation for protection and Serum Visions/Sleight of Hand for additional card selection. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and win the game in one explosive turn, before the opponent has a chance to react.

The focus of this deck is to quickly reduce your own life total in order to make Death's Shadow the biggest threat on the battlefield. Using cards like Street Wraith and Mishra's Bauble to cycle through your deck and lower your life total, combined with disruption cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to control the board, allow you to swing in for massive damage with Death's Shadow and other creatures. The deck aims to be fast, aggressive, and disruptive, overwhelming your opponent before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this Modern Combo Dredge deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Golgari Thug, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam using cards like Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting. Then, by utilizing the dredge mechanic and cards like Life from the Loam, the deck can repeatedly put cards from the graveyard onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures. Using Conflagrate and other cards for additional damage and disruption, this deck aims to win by overpowering the opponent with its graveyard interactions.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to control the game through a combination of countering spells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing spells like Cryptic Command, Kolaghan's Command, and Countersquall, along with versatile creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Tasigur, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, cards like Thought Scour and Ancestral Vision help with card advantage and filtering through the deck to find key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to out-value and outlast the opponent through a mix of disruption and control.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently deal poison counters to the opponent using infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Plague Stinger, while protecting them with cards like Blossoming Defense and Vines of Vastwood. The deck also includes pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth to enhance the infect creatures' power. Additionally, hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize are included to disrupt the opponent's game plan and clear the way for the infect creatures to deal lethal damage.

This deck focuses on aggressively dealing damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. It is centered around low-cost, high-impact creatures and burn spells that can target the opponent directly. The goal is to keep the pressure on the opponent and force them to react to your fast, efficient threats. By combining creature aggression with direct damage spells, this deck aims to close out games swiftly and decisively before the opponent can stabilize. The key concept is to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless assault of damage.
